instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the study on the three-way sorting of Aluminum (Al) in the recycling industry?
Output: The study used raw LIBS spectra for the three-way sorting of Aluminum (Al) in the recycling industry.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the study on the three-way sorting of Aluminum (Al) in the recycling industry?
Output: Baseline correction and feature extraction methods were used in the study on the three-way sorting of Aluminum (Al) in the recycling industry.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the ML and DL models for aluminum sorting, and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the ML and DL models for aluminum sorting is the F1-score. The F1-score is a measure of a model's accuracy that takes into account both precision and recall. It is the harmonic mean of precision and recall, and it provides a balanced assessment of the model's performance.

The F1-score can range from 0 to 1, with 1 being the best possible score. In this study, the ML model achieved an F1-score of 0.80, while the DL model achieved an F1-score of 0.79. These scores indicate that both models performed well in classifying the aluminum scrap into the desired output classes.

instruction: What are the different denoising and feature extraction networks used to optimize the best-performing ML system for the three-way sorting of Aluminum (Al) in the recycling industry using LIBS, ML, and DL?
Output: Six state-of-the-art networks were modified to develop 24 combinations of end-to-end DL models for real-time three-way Al scrap sorting.

instruction: How do the ML and DL models compare in terms of precision, recall, and F1-score for the three-way sorting of Aluminum (Al) using LIBS, ML, and DL?
Output: The ML model achieved a precision of 0.80, recall of 0.81, and F1-score of 0.80 for the three-way sorting of Aluminum (Al) using LIBS, ML, and DL. On the other hand, the DL model achieved a precision of 0.80, recall of 0.79, and F1-score of 0.79 for the same task.
